label: A2BC4_cF56_227_c_b_e-001
title: Spinel (Al$_{2}$MgO$_{4}$, $H1_{1}$) Structure
comments:
An {\em inverse spinel} has four Al atoms on the (8a) sites and (Al,Mg) alloyed on the (16d) sites. 
 The \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B4_cF56_227_ad_e-001}{binary $D7_{2}$} and \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC4_cF56_227_c_b_e-001}{ternary $H1_{1}$} spinel structures are for all intents and purposes identical. We could use $D7_{2}$ for the binary spinels and $H1_{1}$ for the ternaries, but historically this has not been the case. We dual-list this structure only to keep the historical record intact. 
 (Hahn, 1955) has an extensive list of ternary spinels and inverse spinels.
